poem:
### Boil Water Notice

in Brockley  
a clear glass trembles—  
the garden's green  
unblurs  
behind the haze  
of unboiled possibility—  
E. coli,  
a quiet intruder,  
sips morning tea,  
whispers  
through faucets,  
instructs the kettle  
to sing—  
this is survival,  
borne anew  
from brooks unseen  
beneath London clay  
—boil,  
and be clean.
